channel.title: NPC Help Required [PI]
channel.description:
Ok so the thing is EVERY SINGLE NPC HAS AN UNDERSCORE INSTEAD OF A BLANK SPACE D: AND I TRIED REPLACING THE UNDERSCORES BUT THEY HAVEN'T BEEN MANUALLY CHANGED! Meaning there not in entityDef.java. Any ideas on how to fix that?? Is there a way to make it not pickup "_"'s as a actual character If you don't know what I mean well then his is basically what's wrong: The npc names - Jesus_Christ What It should be/I want it to be - Jesus Christ EDIT: I was wrong with how not to fix it, To fix, simply go into EntityDef.java and search for
replaceAll(" ", "_");
You come across something like name = stream.readString().replaceAll("_", " "); Change the (" ", "_") to
("_", " ")

item.title: NPC Help Required [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Many would be very proud of you. Not only did you post the exact problem you were having, but you solved it yourself.

  • Grants you a cookie -

Read full topic

item.title: NPC Help Required [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mee0345 Mee0345
item.description:
@Mee0345 wrote:

Ok so the thing is

EVERY SINGLE NPC HAS AN UNDERSCORE INSTEAD OF A BLANK SPACE D: AND I TRIED REPLACING THE UNDERSCORES BUT THEY HAVEN’T BEEN MANUALLY CHANGED! Meaning there not in entityDef.java. Any ideas on how to fix that??
Is there a way to make it not pickup “_”'s as a actual character

If you don’t know what I mean well then his is basically what’s wrong:
The npc names

  • Jesus_Christ
    What It should be/I want it to be
  • Jesus Christ

EDIT: I was wrong with how not to fix it,
To fix, simply go into EntityDef.java and search for

replaceAll(" ", “");

You come across something like name = stream.readString().replaceAll("”, " “);
Change the (” ", “") to
("
”, " ")

Read full topic
